Recently, the Union Cabinet approved India's Membership of European Bank for Reconstruction & Development (EBRD). In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The EBRD mandates to work only in countries that are committed to democratic principles
  2. EBRD does not finance defence-related projects
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: The EBRD was founded in April 1991 during the dissolution of the Soviet Union with an aim to support countries of the former Eastern Bloc in the process of establishing their private sectors. It offers loans, equity and guarantees thereby promoting direct financing. EBRD mandates to work only in countries that are committed to democratic principles and it promotes environmentally sound and sustainable development.
